thread.title: 2Nd Annual TeamCindy 5K Run for Research to Promote Greater Brain Aneurysm Awareness

author: cbs8
title: 2Nd Annual TeamCindy 5K Run for Research to Promote Greater Brain Aneurysm Awareness
text:
Popular event to take place at Riverside Park in NYC with all proceeds benefitting renowned Brain Aneurysm Foundation
Hanover, MA (PRWEB) October 02, 2015
Please help spread much needed awareness of brain aneurysms by joining the 2nd Annual TeamCindy 5K Run for Research , which is scheduled to take place on Saturday, October 17, 2015 at Riverside Park (103rd Street and Riverside Drive) in New York City.
Now in its second year, TeamCindy and the Mount Sinai Health Systemâ€™s Department of Neurosurgery have partnered to honor the life of Cynthia Lynn Sherwin and promote widespread awareness of the dangers of a ruptured brain aneurysm , the sudden and silent killer that took her life as well as the lives of thousands of others each year.
The cost to participate is $35 for adults who register by October 3rd. After the 3rd, the fee increases to $40. Youth registration is $20 for those 12 and under who register by the date of the event. For those unable to attend on the 17, virtual participation is possible and encouraged. Please visit the event website to register.
The 5K Run/Walk kicks off at 10:00am, with registration beginning an hour earlier, at 9:00am.
For more information, please contact TeamCindy at Info(at)TeamCindy(dot)org.
The Brain Aneurysm Foundation was established in 1994 in Boston, Massachusetts with a mission to promote early detection of brain aneurysms by providing knowledge and raising awareness of the signs, symptoms and risk factors; work with the medical communities to provide support networks for patients and families; as well as to further research that will improve patient outcomes and save lives. For more information about the Brain Aneurysm Foundation, visit http://www.bafound.org .
